name: All material conforms to requirements set out in Clause 6 of MRTS45.
Acceptance Criteria and Frequency (Project Specific) - Visual
Installtion of Pavement Markings conforms to requirements set out in Clause 7.
Acceptance Criteria and Frequency (Project Specific) - Visual
Pavement markings not applied when freshly applied pavement markings may become damaged by rain, fog or condensation before they have dried or set.
Acceptance Criteria and Frequency (Project Specific) - Visual
Pavement surface is thoroughly dry and free from all dirt, loose material and other contaminants immediately before applying the pavement markings
Acceptance Criteria and Frequency (Project Specific) - Visual
In addition to Cl. 7.3, new bitumen sealed surfaces which are to receive pavement markings shall be free of volatile material and solvents.
Acceptance Criteria and Frequency (Project Specific) - Visual
Spotting approved by the Administrator prior to any application of pavement markings
Acceptance Criteria and Frequency (Project Specific) - Visual
Construction procedure for application of pavement markings submitted to the Administrator
Acceptance Criteria and Frequency (Project Specific) - Visual
All Markings are of uniform thickness and intensity
Acceptance Criteria and Frequency (Project Specific) - Visual
Waterborne Paint not heated to greater than 65°C and consists of two coats of paint and glass beads with application rates for the paint as per Table 7.5.2.4

A primer was placed just prior to thermoplastic materials as per manufacturers specifications

Thermoplastic shall be applied at a temperature as per the manufacturers specifications

Thermoplastic applied at a minimum of 2mm thickness

Raised Pavement Markers installed in accordance with Cl 4.6.3 of the MUTCD

Material protected from damage by traffic or other causes until paint is dry and thermoplastic has hardened

Environmental Management Plan (Construction) EMP (C) submitted in accordance with Conditions of Contract.
Works under the Contract shall not start until the EMP (C) is assessed for suitability by the Administrator.
Any amendments to the EMP (C) shall be submitted on a monthly basis and be assessed for suitability by the Administrator.

Environmental site inspections to be conducted daily against all licences, permits, approvals and other environmental performance requirements. All Inspection to be documented with records being submitted to the Administrator on a monthly basis.
Acceptance Criteria and Frequency (Project Specific) - Visual

The Contractor shall be responsible for the management of the below inline with the requirements outlined within the Additional Obligation Documents and MRTS51.1: Landfill Gas Requirements, Contaminated Land Requirements, Water Quality Requirements, Bio Security Requirements
Acceptance Criteria and Frequency (Project Specific) - Visual

The Contractor shall be responsible for the management of Indigenous and non-Indigenous cultural heritage artefacts, sites and values within the worksite. BCC organised Cultural Heritage Training completed and applicable inspection where required.
Acceptance Criteria and Frequency (Project Specific) - Visual
The contractor shall at all times take measures to assist in minimising noise associated with construction activities so as not to cause environmental nuisance or harm.
Acceptance Criteria and Frequency (Project Specific) - Visual
Project records shall include all noise monitoring results if required

Condition survey may need to be conducted prior to commencement of activities as per Annexure MRTS51.1 Cl. 5.5 Copies of condition survey to be forward to Administrator 5 working days before any works that cause vibration start.
Where identified in Cl. 4.3 of Annexure MRTS51.1 the contractor shall undertake vibration monitoring at vibration sensitive receptors.
Acceptance Criteria and Frequency (Project Specific) - Visual
Project records that show compliance with the VMP and shall include all noise monitoring results (if required)
The contractor shall ensure that construction activities do not result in air quality impacts that cause environmental nuisance or harm. Burning of material shall not be permitted
Acceptance Criteria and Frequency (Project Specific) - Visual

The contractor shall be responsible for the management of acid Sulphate Soils and shall address the requirements of MRTS04 General earthworks including the requirements concerning the management of acid sulphate soils
Acceptance Criteria and Frequency (Project Specific) - Visual

The contractor shall be responsible for the management of contaminated sites ( contaminated soils, waste dumps, unexploded ordinances ) within the worksite . The contractor shall address the requirements of MRTS04 General earthworks including the requirements concerning the management of acid sulphate soils
Acceptance Criteria and Frequency (Project Specific) - Visual

The contractor shall take all due care to not harm native fauna. Areas of significance and related management requirements are stated in Cl. 7 of Annexure MRTS51.1. Contact details for emergency wildlife care shall be included on project emergency contact list. Carry out Dawn and Dusk Frog Calling prior to Clearing works and other requirement Frog management where required inline with additional obligation documents.
Acceptance Criteria and Frequency (Project Specific) - Visual
A pre-clearing and post clearing report must be provided by the koala spotter.
The contractor shall be responsible for the management of vegetation within the worksite. The daily site inspections shall include visual assessments of vegetation management measures.
Acceptance Criteria and Frequency (Project Specific) - Visual

All declared pest known to occur within the worksite and associated management requirements are stated in Cl. 9.1 of Annexure MRTS51.1.The contractor shall manage all declared pests (Animals and Plants ) within the worksite by preventing their spread on and off site
Acceptance Criteria and Frequency (Project Specific) - Visual
No waste or litter shall be burnt on site. No waste or litter shall be buried on site unless approved by the Administrator and the administering authority.
Acceptance Criteria and Frequency (Project Specific) - Visual
Fire Ant Inspection Carried out with TMR prior to works commencing. Certificates for applicable imported Items where required.
Acceptance Criteria and Frequency (Project Specific) - Visual
Monthly reporting requirements up-to-date copies of all monitoring results and tracking registers (including waste registers) within 5 business days of the end of a calendar month and upon request.
Acceptance Criteria and Frequency (Project Specific) - Visual
Maintan a animal tamping register inline with the SMP
Acceptance Criteria and Frequency (Project Specific) - Visual

The contractor shall be responsible for the management of all chemicals and fuels within the worksite so as not to cause environmental nuisance or harm. The contractor shall ensure spill kits response equipment are available on site for use in emergency
Acceptance Criteria and Frequency (Project Specific) - Visual
